cyclone.name: FRANKLIN
cyclone.current_location: about 200 miles SSW of Santo Domingo, Dominican Republic
cyclone.trajectory: Turning north tonight then northeast on Thursday, crossing Hispaniola Wednesday and moving into the southwestern Atlantic away from the Greater Antilles

weather_observation.warning_coast: Entire Dominican Republic coast and Haiti south coast
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Hispaniola, Turks & Caicos, coastal Puerto Rico (rain bands), southeastern Bahamas
weather_observation.wind: Gusty winds possible, but chance of sustained tropical-storm force winds is low (<10%)
weather_observation.storm_surge: None significant expected for San Juan, only minor coastal flooding possible on exposed southern shores of Hispaniola
weather_observation.rainfall: 1â€“3 inches common with pockets up to 6 inches in heavier bands, risk of localized flash flooding and urban flooding around the port
weather_observation.other_hazards: Rough seas and dangerous rip currents along north and east-facing beaches
